intro: Psychotria tarambassica, commonly known as Tarambassa, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary and secondary forests. Psychotria tarambassica is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
